perturbation.original_text: Administrator will adopt and maintain an anti-money laundering program in compliance with applicable laws and regulations, including provisions for necessary currency transaction reporting, detection of suspicious activities that could give rise to money laundering, and knowing Administrator's customers. In connection with the services contemplated in this Agreement, Administrator will identify sources of potential money laundering and notify the Fund or its agent of any potential areas that would reasonably raise concerns about the existence of money laundering or unlawful activity.
perturbation.changed_text: Administrator may, at its discretion, adopt an anti-money laundering program. Administrator will consider provisions for currency transaction reporting and detection of suspicious activities. Administrator will attempt to identify sources of potential money laundering and may notify the Fund or its agent of potential areas of concern.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates an anti-money laundering program. The modified version makes the program discretionary, weakens the commitment to currency transaction reporting and suspicious activity detection, and replaces 'will notify' with 'may notify,' reducing the obligation to report potential money laundering, potentially violating anti-money laundering regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act

perturbation.original_text: Administrator agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Trust, the Trust's administrators, investment adviser, and transfer agent, and each of their directors, trustees, officers, employees, agents and each person, if any, who controls them within the meaning of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the "Securities Act"), against any losses, claims, damages, liabilities or expenses to which an indemnitee may become subject insofar as those losses, claims, damages, liabilities or expenses (or actions in respect thereof) arise out of or are based upon (i) any orders that are not timely transmitted by Administrator in accordance with Section 4 of this Agreement or any trades that are cancelled by the Trust or its designee based upon payments for purchases of Shares that are not timely wired; (ii) Administrator's negligence or willful misconduct in performing the Services; (iii) any breach by Administrator of any material representation, warranty or covenant made in this Agreement; or (iv) any requests that are submitted by duly authorized representatives of Administrator on behalf of Participants or Plan Representatives for transaction adjustments (including, but not limited to, the pricing of net purchases or net redemptions of Shares on an "as of" basis). Administrator will reimburse the indemnities for any legal or other expenses reasonably incurred, as incurred, by them in connection with investigating or defending such losses, claims or actions.
perturbation.changed_text: Administrator agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Trust against any losses that are directly caused by Administrator's intentional misconduct. Administrator will consider reimbursing the indemnities for any legal or other expenses incurred, at Administrator's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause provides broad indemnification for the Trust for various scenarios. The modified version significantly narrows the indemnification to only cover losses 'directly caused by Administrator's intentional misconduct,' making it harder to prove and enforce. Also, it changes 'will reimburse' to 'will consider reimbursing', at Administrator's sole discretion which removes Administrator's firm financial obligation, weakening the indemnification protection for the Trust.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Ohio.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with principles of fairness, equity, and mutual cooperation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies Ohio law as governing. The modified text replaces it with vague principles, making it difficult to determine the applicable legal framework, and introduces ambiguity regarding legal interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law principles
